text: Boko Haram militants on motorcycles
assemble under the tree at the bottom of
the screen likely planning an attack but
not far away a Nigerian army tank
advances towards them part of a larger
battalion we watch from an Air Force
surveillance plane 15,000 feet above the
intelligence gathered by this crew is
critical for the troops fighting the
insurgents in recent weeks there's been
an intense military campaign against
Boko Haram soldiers have pushed the
Islamist fighters out of a string of
towns including Baga this market town
was under Boko Haram for almost two
months the insurgents killed hundreds at
random in an incident that shocked the
world now we're the first international
journalists to witness the aftermath we
still don't know how many people were
killed when Boko Haram attacked by a guy
in January but from what we see here
this is supposed to be a major Market
area but it's clear that the invaders
came with one mission to destroy
everyone and everything in their way we
speak to survivors who were held captive
Boko Haram fighters killed my sister so
we attempted to leave three times for my
degree but the militants kept
threatening to shoot us if we left the
town now lies in ruins bodies litter the
streets chilling remains from the
bloodbath the army take us to town after
town each bearing the charred signs that
Boko Haram was here residents fled the
violence in michiga barely a building
was spared it's difficult to even
imagine what would have been going on
here this is a church the pulpit right
here and the pews where the congregation
would have been sitting all devastated
all burnt after six years of failing to
stop Boko Haram Nigerian forces are now
on the offensive neighboring countries
have also joined the fight and with the
recent successes morale is high among
the soldiers on the front line the
insurgency seems to be on the back foot
but Boko Haram is a determined enemy so
this war is far from one turmoil attic
for BBC News Northeast Nigeria
